summary: A practical checklist to help you get settled in your first days and weeks after arriving in Canada.
steps: Apply for your Social Insurance Number (SIN) with Service Canada.
Apply for provincial health coverage and get your health card.
Open a bank account and understand basic banking fees.
Find temporary or permanent housing and understand your lease.
Register children in school if applicable.
Locate newcomer or settlement agencies in your city for language and employment help.

summary: A high-level overview of some mainstream permanent residence (PR) options. Always check official IRCC criteria and get professional advice if needed.
steps: Learn the basics of Express Entry, including FSW, CEC, and FST categories.
Check whether a Provincial Nominee Program (PNP) fits your profile.
Explore family sponsorship if you have eligible relatives in Canada.
Review language testing requirements and educational credential assessments (ECA).
Use official PR eligibility tools on the IRCC website to estimate your options.

summary: Key steps for becoming an international student in Canada.
steps: Choose a designated learning institution (DLI) and confirm your program is eligible for a study permit.
Obtain an official letter of acceptance from the school.
Collect proof of funds, identity documents, and any required police or medical certificates.
Submit your study permit application online and follow biometrics instructions.
Plan for housing, health insurance, and orientation sessions with your institution.
